title: Midcap Stock Mutual Funds Thread The Needle
text:
Despite A Down Day, A Few Break Out To New Highs 
Investors lifted their glass to toast Constellation Brands (NYSE:STZ), which hit a new high after breaking out of a flat base the prior day. It closed within its 5% buy range, up 0.83 to 124.18. Volume was above average. Constellation makes and distributes beer, wine and liquor in the U.S., Canada ... 08/06/2015 06:39 PM ET Credit Agency TransUnion Breaks Out Of IPO Base 
Credit rating agency TransUnion (NYSE:TRU) broke out of an IPO base Wednesday on solid volume. The breakout comes a day after a passel of analysts chimed in by initiating coverage. The company on July 28 issued its first earnings report since coming public. EPS was up 29% from a year ago and ... 08/05/2015 03:00 AM ET Jones Lang LaSalle Beats, CBRE Misses On Earnings 
Shares of commercial real estate giants CBRE Group (NYSE:CBG) and Jones Lang LaSalle (NYSE:JLL) moved in opposite directions early Wednesday after CBRE fell short of quarterly earnings views and Jones Lang LaSalle topped estimates, while both were hit by negative foreign exchange effects. Reporting ... 07/29/2015 10:40 AM ET 56% Of Miami Homes Still Bought With Cash 
The U.S. housing market is swinging away from investor cash purchases to more traditional homebuying and low down payment mortgages. But some spots remain cash-competition havens, including Florida and New York. Miami, with a lot of foreign money pouring in to buy condos, tops the list with 56% of ... 07/24/2015 06:41 PM ET Can Real Estate Giant CBRE Close On New Buy Point? 
With Q2 earnings due next week, real estate giant CBRE Group (NYSE:CBG) is trying to seal the deal on a potential new breakout. CBRE is the world's largest commercial real estate services and investment firm, with a client list that includes 85% of the Fortune 100. But as IBD's The New America ... 07/24/2015 06:39 PM ET Week In Funds: U.S. Stocks Slide; Read What's Ahead 
U.S. diversified stock funds slid 0.54% on average in the week ended Aug. 6, ending a one-week rally. They've lost money for investors on average in five of the past seven weeks. Their loss in the latest week trimmed their year-to-date gain to 2.30%. The week opened amid signs that global economic ... 08/08/2015 08:02 AM ET Top Performing International Funds 
International stock mutual funds outperformed the U.S. stock market for much of the past 10 years. But international funds fell behind in the past year amid difficulties in stimulating moribund economies in Europe and China as well as Greece's debt problems. A $10,000 investment in the average ... 08/05/2015 07:05 PM ET China Stocks: Opportunities Within A Troubled Market 
China stocks in general have resumed the plunge that began in mid-June, largely knifing through attempts by Beijing authorities to place a trampoline below them. Investors and strategists for mutual funds and others see no near-term end to the woes. But you can find China stocks that have held up ... 08/05/2015 06:23 PM ET Is DoubleLine's Jeffrey Gundlach The New Bond King? 
If you're looking to crown someone the Bond King, DoubleLine Capital chief investment officer and CEO Jeffrey Gundlach — also a manager of several of its mutual funds — is a prime contender. Before co-founding DoubleLine along with Philip Barach in 2009, Gundlach ran TCW Total Return ... 08/04/2015 07:44 PM ET
